title: LoL Reddit mods are in trouble

embed.description: The League of Legends subreddit is easily one of the most influential spaces in the game's community, driving hundreds of thousands of pageviews to articles and videos on a daily basis. But like anywhere else on Reddit, the forum's stewardship belongs to a group of volunteer moderators who hold the kill switch over what content lives or dies.

body:
Tl;dr

1. Some  posted a video highly critical of WTFast and their practices (selling subscription time for positive reviews on Steam.)
2. After the post reached the front page of the LoL subreddit, it was pulled for "witch-hunting"
3. Mods were question about their actions, things seemed kind of fishy
4. It turns out that a WTFast affiliate had actually talked to the mods about the post, asking for it to be taken down
5. WTFast denies having any direct influence over the subreddit

Read the article to get the full picture of what's going on, I just tried to sum it up as best as I could.

Thoughts?
